examples.title: Identifying Prime Numbers
examples.problem_text: Which of the following is a prime number?
examples.answer_explanation:
A prime number is divisible only by 1 and itself.

Check each option:
A. 1 is NOT prime (by definition)
B. 21 = 3 × 7 (divisible by 3 and 7)
C. 27 = 3 × 9 (divisible by 3)
D. 29 is only divisible by 1 and 29 ✓
E. 35 = 5 × 7 (divisible by 5 and 7)

CRITICAL FACTS:
• 1 is NOT a prime number
• 2 is the ONLY even prime number
• To test: check divisibility by 2, 3, 5, 7, 11...

The answer is D.

examples.title: Divisibility by 3
examples.problem_text: Which of the following numbers is divisible by 3?
examples.answer_explanation:
A number is divisible by 3 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 3.

Check each option:

A. 1,234 → 1+2+3+4 = 10 → 10÷3 = 3.33... ✗
B. 2,467 → 2+4+6+7 = 19 → 19÷3 = 6.33... ✗
C. 3,571 → 3+5+7+1 = 16 → 16÷3 = 5.33... ✗
D. 4,725 → 4+7+2+5 = 18 → 18÷3 = 6 ✓
E. 5,892 → 5+8+9+2 = 24 → 24÷3 = 8 ✓ (also works!)

Both D and E are divisible by 3, but D appears first.

The answer is D.

examples.title: Greatest Common Factor
examples.problem_text: What is the greatest common factor (GCF) of 48 and 72?
examples.answer_explanation:
Find the largest number that divides evenly into both 48 and 72.

Method 1: List factors
Factors of 48: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 48
Factors of 72: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, 72

Common factors: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24
Greatest = 24

Method 2: Prime factorization
48 = 2⁴ × 3
72 = 2³ × 3²
GCF = 2³ × 3 = 8 × 3 = 24

The answer is D.

examples.title: Even and Odd Properties
examples.problem_text: If x is an odd integer and y is an even integer, which of the following must be odd?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use the rules for even and odd operations.

A. x + y = Odd + Even = Odd ✓

B. x × y = Odd × Even = Even ✗
   (Any number times even = even)

C. y × y = Even × Even = Even ✗

D. x + x = Odd + Odd = Even ✗

E. y + y = Even + Even = Even ✗

CRITICAL RULES:
• Even + Even = Even
• Odd + Odd = Even
• Even + Odd = Odd ✓
• Even × Anything = Even
• Odd × Odd = Odd

The answer is A.

examples.title: Consecutive Integers
examples.problem_text: The sum of three consecutive integers is 72. What is the largest of these integers?
examples.answer_explanation:
Set up consecutive integers as n, n+1, n+2.

Step 1: Write equation
n + (n+1) + (n+2) = 72

Step 2: Simplify
3n + 3 = 72

Step 3: Solve for n
3n = 69
n = 23

Step 4: Find the largest
The three integers are 23, 24, 25
Largest = 25

Check: 23 + 24 + 25 = 72 ✓

The answer is D.
